- Job scheduling: **BullMQ/Redis**, **Sidekiq**, or **Celery**.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (multi-step sequencing + email integration).[6]  
- Senior: **4–5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$112k–$134k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$140k–$175k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior backend‑leaning full‑stack**.  
- 1 × **Frontend/full‑stack**.  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 7. HR / Recruiting MVP (BambooHR-/Greenhouse-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Job postings & pipeline** (stages, candidates).  
- **Candidate profiles** (resume upload, notes, tags).  
- **Application forms** (public job pages + simple form).  
- **Interview scheduling (basic)** with calendar export (ICS links; OAuth to calendars later).  
- **Email templates** & status updates.  
- **Simple reports** (time to hire, candidates per stage).  
- **Roles & permissions** (recruiter, hiring manager, admin).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**.  
- Backend: **Django** or **Node.js (NestJS)**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- File storage: **S3/GCS** for resumes.  
- Email: **SendGrid/Postmark**.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **4.5–5.5 months**.  
- Senior: **3.5–4.5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$101k–$123k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$122k–$158k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack**.  
- 1 × **Full‑stack/front‑end**.  
- Part‑time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 8. Accounting / Finance MVP (QuickBooks-style, light)

Accounting is data- and rules-heavy, so even an MVP is on the higher side.

**Core MVP features**

- **Chart of accounts** setup.  
- **Invoices** (create, send via email, PDF).  
- **Expenses & simple bank transactions** (manual entry or CSV import).  
- **Basic double-entry ledger** (journal entries auto-created from invoices/expenses).  
- **Dashboards & reports** (P&L, basic balance sheet).  
- **Tax-related fields & simple settings** (currency, tax rates).  
- **User roles** (owner, accountant, staff).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**.  
- Backend: **Django** or **Rails** (mature for finance CRUD + validations).  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- PDFs: **WeasyPrint**, **wkhtmltopdf**, or **Puppeteer**.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (complex validations & reports).[6][8]  
- Senior: **4–5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$112k–$134k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$140k–$175k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior backend‑leaning full‑stack** (must understand ledgers).  
- 1 × **Frontend/full‑stack dev**.  
- Part‑time **designer, QA, DevOps**, possibly **domain consultant (accountant)** a few days.

---

### 9. Inventory Management MVP

**Core MVP features**

- **Products & SKUs** (variants, barcodes/IDs).  
- **Locations/warehouses** (stock per location).  
- **Stock movements** (receipts, issues, transfers).  
- **Basic reorder thresholds** & alerts.  
- **Purchase orders (simple)**.  
- **Inventory valuation & reports** (stock on hand, movement history).  
- **User roles** (warehouse staff, manager).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**.  
- Backend: **Django** or **Node.js (NestJS)**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL** (transactions, constraints).  
- Optional: simple **REST API** for future e‑commerce integrations.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **4.5–5.5 months**.  
- Senior: **3.5–4.5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$101k–$123k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$122k–$158k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack**.  
- 1 × **Full‑stack**.  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 10. Document Management MVP (Dropbox-/Google Drive-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Folder & file structure** (upload, rename, move, delete, restore from trash).  
- **File storage & versioning (basic)**.  
- **Sharing & permissions** (links with access control; internal users).  
- **Preview support** for common formats (PDF, images).  
- **Search** on filenames and metadata.  
- **Activity logs** (who uploaded/modified).  
- **User & team management**.

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS)** or **Go** (if optimizing for file throughput).  
- DB: **PostgreSQL** for metadata.  
- Files: **AWS S3/GCP Storage**, presigned URLs.  
- Search: Postgres text search; optionally **OpenSearch/Elastic** later.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (file handling, sharing, permissions).[6][7]  
- Senior: **4–5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$112k–$134k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$140k–$175k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack** (storage & security).  
- 1 × **Full‑stack/front‑end**.  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### How this matches agency/MVP guides

- Multiple 2025 guides place **SaaS MVPs at $20k–$80k development-only** for simple–medium complexity, with **3–6 month timelines** typical for full-featured B2B tools.[1][4][6][7][9][10]  
- Email and accounting tools often exceed the low end due to complexity, with some Mailchimp-style estimates in the **$120k–$180k** range for a robust MVP.[8]  
- Hourly assumptions (~$50–$75/hr offshore, $100–$200/hr US/EU) and total project cost ranges ($10k–$50k small MVPs, $50k–$150k+ for more complex SaaS) are consistent with the cost brackets above.[2][4][7][8]  

If you tell me which 2–3 of these you’re most serious about, I can tighten the feature list and adjust timelines/costs to a “lean but still credible” launch version.

mvp_types.name: Document Management
mvp_types.research_summary:
A realistic 2024–2025 benchmark: most **B2B SaaS MVPs** with 2–3 user roles and 15–25 features fall into **3–6 months** and **$30k–$80k** for solid agency‑grade builds.[1][6][9] I’ll size each of your 10 types in that range (simpler ones toward the lower end, complex ones higher), assuming a *single web app MVP* (no mobile) and a modern JS/TS stack.

**Global assumptions**

- Hours/month per dev: ~140
- Mid-tier rate: **$60–$100/hr** → I’ll use **$80/hr** midpoint.
- Senior rate: **$100–$150/hr** → I’ll use **$125/hr** midpoint.
- 2 devs full time → ~280 hrs/month.  
- Industry ranges for SaaS MVPs:  
  - Simple: $20k–$40k, 6–10 weeks[1][4]  
  - Standard B2B SaaS: $35k–$60k, 10–14 weeks[1]  
  - Most MVPs overall: $25k–$80k, 4–8+ weeks, 3–6 months window depending on scope.[1][4][6][7][9][10]

---

### 1. CRM MVP (Salesforce-/HubSpot-style)

**Core MVP features (5–7)**  
- **Lead & contact management** (companies, people, timelines, notes).  
- **Pipeline / deal stages** with Kanban or list view and stage totals.  
- **Tasks & reminders** tied to contacts/deals.  
- **Basic reporting** (pipeline by stage, won/lost, simple filters).  
- **Email integration (light)**: log emails via BCC/dropbox address, no full sync.  
- **User roles & permissions** (admin vs sales rep).  
- **Simple integrations**: Stripe or payment link field, basic webhook or Zapier-ready API.

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**, Vite or Next.js (CSR/SSR), UI lib: **MUI** or **Ant Design**.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS/Express)** or **Ruby on Rails** for speed.  
- Database: **PostgreSQL** (transactions, reporting-friendly).  
- Key libraries/services:  
  - Auth: **Auth0** or **Clerk**.  
  - Email: **SendGrid** or **Postmark**.  
  - Payments (if needed): **Stripe**.  
  - Search/filter: Postgres + indexes, optional **ElasticSearch/Meilisearch** later.

**Timeline**

- With 2 mid-tier devs: **4–5 months** (fits 3–6 month MVP window for business SaaS).[6][9]  
- With 2 senior devs: **3–4 months** (more reuse, better architecture).

**Cost estimate**

- Mid-tier: 4–5 months × 280 hrs × $80/hr ≈ **$90k–$112k** (can be squeezed toward $60k–$80k with reduced scope, but realistic agency-grade is in this band for CRM complexity).[1][7][8]  
- Senior: 3–4 months × 280 hrs × $125/hr ≈ **$105k–$140k**.

**Team composition**

- 1 × **Tech lead / senior full‑stack** (can code + architect).  
- 1 × **Full‑stack / frontend dev**.  
- Part‑time: **Product designer (UX/UI)**, **QA**, **DevOps** (or handled by senior).

---

### 2. Project Management MVP (Asana-/Trello-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Projects & boards** (list or Kanban).  
- **Tasks with statuses**, due dates, assignees, checklists.  
- **Comments & basic activity log** per task.  
- **File attachments** (stored in S3/GCS).  
- **Simple notifications** (email + in-app).  
- **Basic reporting** (overdue tasks, tasks by assignee/project).  
- **Workspace & member management**.

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**, drag-and-drop via **react-beautiful-dnd** or similar.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS/Express)** or **Django**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- Files: **AWS S3** or **GCP Storage**.  
- Notifications: **SendGrid/Postmark**, **WebSockets** or **Pusher/Ably** for live updates.

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **4–5 months** (real-time-ish UI, attachments, collaboration).[6]  
- Senior: **3–4 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$90k–$112k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$105k–$140k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack**.  
- 1 × **Frontend-oriented full‑stack**.  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 3. Team Collaboration / Knowledge Base MVP (Notion-/Confluence-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Workspaces & permissions** (team, guests).  
- **Pages with rich text editor** (headings, bullets, links, basic tables).  
- **Nested page hierarchy** or tags.  
- **Search** across titles/body.  
- **Comments** on pages.  
- **Page history / simple versioning**.  
- **Basic templates** (meeting notes, docs).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**, rich text via **Slate.js**, **TipTap**, or **Quill**.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS)** or **Ruby on Rails**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL** (JSONB for blocks).  
- Search: **Postgres full-text search**, optional Meilisearch/Elastic later.  
- Auth: Auth0/Clerk; file storage (if attachments) S3.

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (rich editor + hierarchy + search is nontrivial).[6]  
- Senior: **3.5–4.5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 5–6 months → ≈ **$112k–$134k**.  
- Senior: 3.5–4.5 months → ≈ **$122k–$158k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack** (editor & data model).  
- 1 × **Frontend dev** (editor UX).  
- Part-time **product designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 4. Email Marketing MVP (Mailchimp-style)

Email platforms tend to cost more due to deliverability, compliance, and campaign logic.[8]

**Core MVP features**

- **Audience management** (lists, basic segments, custom fields).  
- **Campaign builder** with simple drag‑and‑drop or block-based editor.  
- **Email sending via third‑party SMTP** (SendGrid/Mailgun) with rate limiting.  
- **Templates** (save & reuse).  
- **Basic automation** (welcome series or 1–2 simple triggers).  
- **Campaign analytics** (opens, clicks, bounces).  
- **Unsubscribe & compliance basics** (CAN‑SPAM/GDPR basics).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**, editor using **GrapesJS**, **Unlayer**, or similar.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS)** or **Django**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- Email: **SendGrid/Mailgun/SES**.  
- Queue: **Redis + BullMQ**, **Celery**, or **Sidekiq** for sending/analytics.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (aligns with higher-complexity MVPs and email-specific guides stating $120k–$180k for Mailchimp-quality MVPs).[6][8]  
- Senior: **4–5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$112k–$134k** (lower end of Mailchimp-style range if automation is limited).[8]  
- Senior: 4–5 months → ≈ **$140k–$175k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior backend‑leaning full‑stack** (queues, deliverability).  
- 1 × **Frontend dev** (campaign editor).  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**, optionally **product manager**.

---

### 5. Customer Support MVP (Zendesk-/Intercom-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Ticketing system** (create, assign, statuses, priorities).  
- **Shared inbox** (email → ticket).  
- **Basic live chat widget** on website.  
- **Customer profiles** with ticket history.  
- **Macros / canned responses**.  
- **Simple reports** (tickets by status/agent, response time).  
- **Workflow rules (very basic)**: e.g., auto-assign by inbox.

**Tech stack**

- Frontend (app): **React + TypeScript**.  
- Frontend (chat widget): lightweight **React** or vanilla JS embeddable snippet.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS)** or **Django**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- Realtime: **WebSockets**, Pusher/Ably.  
- Email in/out: **SendGrid**, **Mailgun**, or **Postmark**.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (multi-channel, real-time).[6][9]  
- Senior: **3.5–4.5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$112k–$134k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$122k–$158k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack** (chat + ticket engine).  
- 1 × **Full‑stack**.  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 6. Sales Automation MVP (Outreach-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Contact & account sync** (simple CSV import, later CRM integration).  
- **Sequences / cadences** (time-based email steps).  
- **Email sending** from connected inbox (start with SMTP OAuth for Gmail/Outlook or SendGrid as intermediary).  
- **Task generation** (call tasks, manual steps).  
- **Basic analytics** (sequence performance, open/click/reply rates).  
- **User roles & teams**.  
- **Compliance & safety** (daily send caps, unsubscribe management).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**.  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS)** or **Django**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- Email: Gmail/Outlook via OAuth + **SendGrid/Mailgun** fallback.  
- Job scheduling: **BullMQ/Redis**, **Sidekiq**, or **Celery**.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **5–6 months** (multi-step sequencing + email integration).[6]  
- Senior: **4–5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$112k–$134k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$140k–$175k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior backend‑leaning full‑stack**.  
- 1 × **Frontend/full‑stack**.  
- Part-time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 7. HR / Recruiting MVP (BambooHR-/Greenhouse-style)

**Core MVP features**

- **Job postings & pipeline** (stages, candidates).  
- **Candidate profiles** (resume upload, notes, tags).  
- **Application forms** (public job pages + simple form).  
- **Interview scheduling (basic)** with calendar export (ICS links; OAuth to calendars later).  
- **Email templates** & status updates.  
- **Simple reports** (time to hire, candidates per stage).  
- **Roles & permissions** (recruiter, hiring manager, admin).

**Tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**.  
- Backend: **Django** or **Node.js (NestJS)**.  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**.  
- File storage: **S3/GCS** for resumes.  
- Email: **SendGrid/Postmark**.  

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **4.5–5.5 months**.  
- Senior: **3.5–4.5 months**.

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: ≈ **$101k–$123k**.  
- Senior: ≈ **$122k–$158k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Senior full‑stack**.  
- 1 × **Full‑stack/front‑end**.  
- Part‑time **designer, QA, DevOps**.

---

### 8. Accounting / Finance MVP (QuickBooks-style, light)

Accounting is data- and rules-heavy, so even an MVP is on the higher side.

**Core MVP features**

- **Chart of accounts** setup.

**Cost**

- Senior: ≈ **$140k–$175k**.

**Team**

- 1 × **Frontend/full‑stack dev**.

---

### 9. Inventory Management MVP

**Core MVP features**

- **Products & SKUs** (variants, barcodes/IDs).  
- **Locations/warehouses** (stock per location).  
- **Stock movements** (receipts, issues, transfers).  
- **Basic reorder thresholds** & alerts.

- Email and accounting tools often exceed the low end due to complexity, with some Mailchimp-style estimates in the **$120k–$180k** range for a robust MVP.[8]

mvp_types.name: Two-Sided Marketplace
mvp_types.research_summary:
Here is a concise, numbers‑driven blueprint per marketplace/platform type. Timelines and costs assume:

- 2 × **mid‑tier** devs at **$60–100/hr**
- 2 × **senior** devs at **$100–150/hr**
- Effort estimates grounded in typical marketplace MVP scopes and feature sets described in marketplace guides.[3][6][7]

I’ll keep stacks consistent across types (with small variations) to make decisions easier.

---

## 1. Two‑Sided Marketplace (Airbnb/Etsy‑style)

**Core MVP features** (buyers + sellers + ops)[3][6][7]  
- User auth, profiles (buyer/seller roles)  
- Seller onboarding: create/manage listings (products or spaces)  
- Listing pages with photos, descriptions, price, availability  
- Search, basic filters (category, price, location)[3][6][7]  
- Cart or “request to book / buy now” flow  
- Secure payments (Stripe/PayPal) and basic commission logic[3][6]  
- Orders management (seller & buyer dashboards)[3]  
- Reviews & ratings[3][6][7]  
- Messaging between buyer/seller[3]  
- Basic admin panel (users, listings, orders, payouts)[3][6]

**Recommended tech stack**  
- Frontend: **React** + **Next.js**, Tailwind CSS  
- Backend: **Node.js + NestJS** (or Express)  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Auth: JWT + OAuth2 (e.g., Google)  
- Payments: **Stripe Connect**  
- Infra: **AWS** (Elastic Beanstalk or ECS/Fargate, RDS, S3, CloudFront)[1][4]  
- DevOps: Docker, GitHub Actions, basic CI/CD[4]

**Timeline (MVP)**  
- With 2 mid‑tier devs: **12–16 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost range**  
- Mid‑tier: 12–16 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 960–1,280  
  - Cost: **$57,600–128,000** (at $60–100/hr)  
- Senior: 8–10 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 640–800  
  - Cost: **$64,000–120,000** (at $100–150/hr)

**Team composition (lean)**  
- 1 × **PM/Product Owner** (part‑time)  
- 1 × **UI/UX designer** (part‑time)  
- 2 × **full‑stack devs** (mid or senior)  
- 1 × **QA engineer** (part‑time)  
- 1 × **DevOps** (very part‑time or shared)[4]

---

## 2. Service Marketplace (TaskRabbit/Thumbtack‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, profiles (clients + service providers)  
- Provider profiles: skills, hourly rate, service areas  
- Service categories & simple catalog  
- Job posting / service request form  
- Matching/browsing providers & search filters  
- Booking/acceptance flow (request → quote → accept)  
- Payments, commissions, payouts (Stripe Connect)[3][6]  
- Messaging, notifications (email + in‑app)[3]  
- Ratings & reviews  
- Basic admin panel (disputes, refunds, provider KYC)

**Recommended tech stack**  
Same as #1; add:  
- Optional: **Map APIs** (Google Maps) for location‑based services

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (12–14 weeks → 960–1,120 h): **$57,600–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 3. Rental Marketplace (Turo/Fat Llama‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, renter/owner roles  
- Owner onboarding: rental listing creation (items or vehicles)  
- Availability calendar, pricing rules (daily / hourly)  
- Search with filters (dates, location, price, category)  
- Booking flow with date/time selection and owner approval  
- Payments (hold/deposit logic to start with Stripe)[3][6]  
- Basic insurance/terms acknowledgement (non‑legal MVP)  
- Messaging, notifications  
- Reviews & ratings  
- Admin panel (fraud checks flags, manual KYC notes)

**Tech stack**  
Same as #2, plus:  
- Strong use of **PostgreSQL** for availability & bookings  
- Optional: background jobs with **BullMQ / Redis** for reminders, holds

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **13–16 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (13–16 weeks → 1,040–1,280 h): **$62,400–128,000**  
- Senior (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$64,000–120,000**

**Team composition**  
Similar to #1, but with more backend:  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 1 frontend dev  
- 1 backend‑heavy full‑stack dev

mvp_types.name: Service Marketplace
mvp_types.research_summary:
Here is a concise, numbers‑driven blueprint per marketplace/platform type. Timelines and costs assume:

- 2 × **mid‑tier** devs at **$60–100/hr**
- 2 × **senior** devs at **$100–150/hr**
- Effort estimates grounded in typical marketplace MVP scopes and feature sets described in marketplace guides.[3][6][7]

I’ll keep stacks consistent across types (with small variations) to make decisions easier.

---

## 1. Two‑Sided Marketplace (Airbnb/Etsy‑style)

**Core MVP features** (buyers + sellers + ops)[3][6][7]  
- User auth, profiles (buyer/seller roles)  
- Seller onboarding: create/manage listings (products or spaces)  
- Listing pages with photos, descriptions, price, availability  
- Search, basic filters (category, price, location)[3][6][7]  
- Cart or “request to book / buy now” flow  
- Secure payments (Stripe/PayPal) and basic commission logic[3][6]  
- Orders management (seller & buyer dashboards)[3]  
- Reviews & ratings[3][6][7]  
- Messaging between buyer/seller[3]  
- Basic admin panel (users, listings, orders, payouts)[3][6]

**Recommended tech stack**  
- Frontend: **React** + **Next.js**, Tailwind CSS  
- Backend: **Node.js + NestJS** (or Express)  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Auth: JWT + OAuth2 (e.g., Google)  
- Payments: **Stripe Connect**  
- Infra: **AWS** (Elastic Beanstalk or ECS/Fargate, RDS, S3, CloudFront)[1][4]  
- DevOps: Docker, GitHub Actions, basic CI/CD[4]

**Timeline (MVP)**  
- With 2 mid‑tier devs: **12–16 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost range**  
- Mid‑tier: 12–16 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 960–1,280  
  - Cost: **$57,600–128,000** (at $60–100/hr)  
- Senior: 8–10 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 640–800  
  - Cost: **$64,000–120,000** (at $100–150/hr)

**Team composition (lean)**  
- 1 × **PM/Product Owner** (part‑time)  
- 1 × **UI/UX designer** (part‑time)  
- 2 × **full‑stack devs** (mid or senior)  
- 1 × **QA engineer** (part‑time)  
- 1 × **DevOps** (very part‑time or shared)[4]

- Messaging, notifications (email + in‑app)[3]  
- Ratings & reviews  
- Basic admin panel (disputes, refunds, provider KYC)

**Recommended tech stack**  
Same as #1; add:  
- Optional: **Map APIs** (Google Maps) for location‑based services

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (12–14 weeks → 960–1,120 h): **$57,600–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

  - Cost: **$57,600–128,000** (at $60–100/hr)

  - Hours: 640–800  
  - Cost: **$64,000–120,000** (at $100–150/hr)

- 1 × **DevOps** (very part‑time or shared)[4]

## 2. Service Marketplace (TaskRabbit/Thumbtack‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, profiles (clients + service providers)  
- Provider profiles: skills, hourly rate, service areas

- Job posting / service request form  
- Matching/browsing providers & search filters  
- Booking/acceptance flow (request → quote → accept)

- Messaging, notifications (email + in‑app)[3]

- Basic admin panel (disputes, refunds, provider KYC)

Same as #1; add:  
- Optional: **Map APIs** (Google Maps) for location‑based services

- 2 mid‑tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (12–14 weeks → 960–1,120 h): **$57,600–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

## 3. Rental Marketplace (Turo/Fat Llama‑style)

- Mid‑tier (10–12 weeks → 800–960 h): **$48,000–96,000**

- Frontend: React + Next.js

- Mid‑tier (11–14 weeks → 880–1,120 h): **$52,800–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT, light)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]

- Frontend: React + Next.js  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS (or Ruby on Rails, strong for subscriptions)

- Payments: Stripe Billing / Subscriptions[1]  
- Infra: AWS or Azure[4]

- 2 mid‑tier: **11–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (11–14 weeks → 880–1,120 h): **$52,800–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

**Notes on sources & structure**

- Marketplace MVP guides consistently call out **auth, listings, search/filtering, payments, reviews, and admin panel** as core MVP scope for marketplaces.[3][6][7]  
- SaaS MVP guides emphasize **cloud infra (AWS/Azure/GCP), Stripe/PayPal payments, and analytics** as best practice for 2024‑era MVPs.[1][4][5][8]

mvp_types.name: Job Board
mvp_types.research_summary:
Here is a concise, numbers‑driven blueprint per marketplace/platform type. Timelines and costs assume:

- 2 × **mid‑tier** devs at **$60–100/hr**
- 2 × **senior** devs at **$100–150/hr**
- Effort estimates grounded in typical marketplace MVP scopes and feature sets described in marketplace guides.[3][6][7]

I’ll keep stacks consistent across types (with small variations) to make decisions easier.

---

## 1. Two‑Sided Marketplace (Airbnb/Etsy‑style)

**Core MVP features** (buyers + sellers + ops)[3][6][7]  
- User auth, profiles (buyer/seller roles)  
- Seller onboarding: create/manage listings (products or spaces)  
- Listing pages with photos, descriptions, price, availability  
- Search, basic filters (category, price, location)[3][6][7]  
- Cart or “request to book / buy now” flow  
- Secure payments (Stripe/PayPal) and basic commission logic[3][6]  
- Orders management (seller & buyer dashboards)[3]  
- Reviews & ratings[3][6][7]  
- Messaging between buyer/seller[3]  
- Basic admin panel (users, listings, orders, payouts)[3][6]

**Recommended tech stack**  
- Frontend: **React** + **Next.js**, Tailwind CSS  
- Backend: **Node.js + NestJS** (or Express)  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Auth: JWT + OAuth2 (e.g., Google)  
- Payments: **Stripe Connect**  
- Infra: **AWS** (Elastic Beanstalk or ECS/Fargate, RDS, S3, CloudFront)[1][4]  
- DevOps: Docker, GitHub Actions, basic CI/CD[4]

**Timeline (MVP)**  
- With 2 mid‑tier devs: **12–16 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

- 2 × **mid‑tier** devs at **$60–100/hr**

## 1. Two‑Sided Marketplace (Airbnb/Etsy‑style)

**Core MVP features** (buyers + sellers + ops)[3][6][7]  
- User auth, profiles (buyer/seller roles)

- Listing pages with photos, descriptions, price, availability  
- Search, basic filters (category, price, location)[3][6][7]  
- Cart or “request to book / buy now” flow  
- Secure payments (Stripe/PayPal) and basic commission logic[3][6]  
- Orders management (seller & buyer dashboards)[3]  
- Reviews & ratings[3][6][7]  
- Messaging between buyer/seller[3]  
- Basic admin panel (users, listings, orders, payouts)[3][6]

**Recommended tech stack**  
- Frontend: **React** + **Next.js**, Tailwind CSS  
- Backend: **Node.js + NestJS** (or Express)  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Auth: JWT + OAuth2 (e.g., Google)  
- Payments: **Stripe Connect**  
- Infra: **AWS** (Elastic Beanstalk or ECS/Fargate, RDS, S3, CloudFront)[1][4]  
- DevOps: Docker, GitHub Actions, basic CI/CD[4]

**Timeline (MVP)**  
- With 2 mid‑tier devs: **12–16 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost range**  
- Mid‑tier: 12–16 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 960–1,280  
  - Cost: **$57,600–128,000** (at $60–100/hr)  
- Senior: 8–10 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 640–800  
  - Cost: **$64,000–120,000** (at $100–150/hr)

- 1 × **UI/UX designer** (part‑time)

- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

- 1 DevOps (PT)

- Senior (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$64,000–120,000**

mvp_types.name: Product Marketplace
mvp_types.research_summary:
Here is a concise, numbers‑driven blueprint per marketplace/platform type. Timelines and costs assume:

- 2 × **mid‑tier** devs at **$60–100/hr**
- 2 × **senior** devs at **$100–150/hr**
- Effort estimates grounded in typical marketplace MVP scopes and feature sets described in marketplace guides.[3][6][7]

I’ll keep stacks consistent across types (with small variations) to make decisions easier.

---

## 1. Two‑Sided Marketplace (Airbnb/Etsy‑style)

**Core MVP features** (buyers + sellers + ops)[3][6][7]  
- User auth, profiles (buyer/seller roles)  
- Seller onboarding: create/manage listings (products or spaces)  
- Listing pages with photos, descriptions, price, availability  
- Search, basic filters (category, price, location)[3][6][7]  
- Cart or “request to book / buy now” flow  
- Secure payments (Stripe/PayPal) and basic commission logic[3][6]  
- Orders management (seller & buyer dashboards)[3]  
- Reviews & ratings[3][6][7]  
- Messaging between buyer/seller[3]  
- Basic admin panel (users, listings, orders, payouts)[3][6]

**Recommended tech stack**  
- Frontend: **React** + **Next.js**, Tailwind CSS  
- Backend: **Node.js + NestJS** (or Express)  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Auth: JWT + OAuth2 (e.g., Google)  
- Payments: **Stripe Connect**  
- Infra: **AWS** (Elastic Beanstalk or ECS/Fargate, RDS, S3, CloudFront)[1][4]  
- DevOps: Docker, GitHub Actions, basic CI/CD[4]

**Timeline (MVP)**  
- With 2 mid‑tier devs: **12–16 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost range**  
- Mid‑tier: 12–16 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 960–1,280  
  - Cost: **$57,600–128,000** (at $60–100/hr)  
- Senior: 8–10 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week  
  - Hours: 640–800  
  - Cost: **$64,000–120,000** (at $100–150/hr)

**Team composition (lean)**  
- 1 × **PM/Product Owner** (part‑time)  
- 1 × **UI/UX designer** (part‑time)  
- 2 × **full‑stack devs** (mid or senior)  
- 1 × **QA engineer** (part‑time)  
- 1 × **DevOps** (very part‑time or shared)[4]

---

## 2. Service Marketplace (TaskRabbit/Thumbtack‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, profiles (clients + service providers)  
- Provider profiles: skills, hourly rate, service areas  
- Service categories & simple catalog  
- Job posting / service request form  
- Matching/browsing providers & search filters  
- Booking/acceptance flow (request → quote → accept)  
- Payments, commissions, payouts (Stripe Connect)[3][6]  
- Messaging, notifications (email + in‑app)[3]  
- Ratings & reviews  
- Basic admin panel (disputes, refunds, provider KYC)

**Recommended tech stack**  
Same as #1; add:  
- Optional: **Map APIs** (Google Maps) for location‑based services

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (12–14 weeks → 960–1,120 h): **$57,600–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 3. Rental Marketplace (Turo/Fat Llama‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, renter/owner roles  
- Owner onboarding: rental listing creation (items or vehicles)  
- Availability calendar, pricing rules (daily / hourly)  
- Search with filters (dates, location, price, category)  
- Booking flow with date/time selection and owner approval  
- Payments (hold/deposit logic to start with Stripe)[3][6]  
- Basic insurance/terms acknowledgement (non‑legal MVP)  
- Messaging, notifications  
- Reviews & ratings  
- Admin panel (fraud checks flags, manual KYC notes)

**Tech stack**  
Same as #2, plus:  
- Strong use of **PostgreSQL** for availability & bookings  
- Optional: background jobs with **BullMQ / Redis** for reminders, holds

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **13–16 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (13–16 weeks → 1,040–1,280 h): **$62,400–128,000**  
- Senior (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$64,000–120,000**

**Team composition**  
Similar to #1, but with more backend:  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 1 frontend dev  
- 1 backend‑heavy full‑stack dev  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 4. Job Board (Indeed/AngelList‑style)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]  
- Auth, roles (employer, candidate)  
- Employer profiles, company pages  
- Job posting forms, job listing pages  
- Search & filters (role, location, salary range, type)  
- Job application flow (apply with profile/CV upload)  
- Email notifications (new jobs, application received)  
- Basic admin panel (moderate jobs, manage users)  
- Optional early monetization: paid job posts via Stripe

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: Next.js + React  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS or Rails/Django (CRUD‑heavy)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Auth: JWT/OAuth  
- Infra: AWS/Azure[1][4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$38,400–80,000**  
- Senior (5–7 weeks → 400–560 h): **$40,000–84,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)

## 5. Freelance Platform (Upwork/Fiverr‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]

- Ratings & reviews

**Tech stack**  
Same as #1, plus:

- Optional: real‑time messaging via **WebSockets** (Socket.io)

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **14–18 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **9–11 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (14–18 weeks → 1,120–1,440 h): **$67,200–144,000**  
- Senior (9–11 weeks → 720–880 h): **$72,000–132,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 1 frontend dev  
- 1 backend‑heavy full‑stack dev  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 6. Course Marketplace (Udemy/Skillshare‑style)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]  
- Auth, roles (instructor, student)  
- Instructor onboarding and course creation (title, sections, video links, resources)

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: React + Next.js

- DB: PostgreSQL

- Payments: Stripe  
- Analytics: basic Mixpanel/GA for course engagement[1][4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **12–16 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (12–16 weeks → 960–1,280 h): **$57,600–128,000**  
- Senior (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$64,000–120,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 7. Product Marketplace (Amazon/eBay‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]

## 1. Two‑Sided Marketplace (Airbnb/Etsy‑style)

**Core MVP features** (buyers + sellers + ops)[3][6][7]

- Search, basic filters (category, price, location)[3][6][7]  
- Cart or “request to book / buy now” flow  
- Secure payments (Stripe/PayPal) and basic commission logic[3][6]  
- Orders management (seller & buyer dashboards)[3]  
- Reviews & ratings[3][6][7]  
- Messaging between buyer/seller[3]

**Recommended tech stack**  
- Frontend: **React** + **Next.js**, Tailwind CSS  
- Backend: **Node.js + NestJS** (or Express)  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Auth: JWT + OAuth2 (e.g., Google)  
- Payments: **Stripe Connect**  
- Infra: **AWS** (Elastic Beanstalk or ECS/Fargate, RDS, S3, CloudFront)[1][4]

**Timeline (MVP)**  
- With 2 mid‑tier devs: **12–16 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost range**  
- Mid‑tier: 12–16 weeks × 2 devs × 40 h/week

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (13–16 weeks → 1,040–1,280 h): **$62,400–128,000**  
- Senior (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$64,000–120,000**

**Team composition**  
Similar to #1, but with more backend:  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 1 frontend dev  
- 1 backend‑heavy full‑stack dev  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 4. Job Board (Indeed/AngelList‑style)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]  
- Auth, roles (employer, candidate)  
- Employer profiles, company pages  
- Job posting forms, job listing pages  
- Search & filters (role, location, salary range, type)  
- Job application flow (apply with profile/CV upload)  
- Email notifications (new jobs, application received)  
- Basic admin panel (moderate jobs, manage users)  
- Optional early monetization: paid job posts via Stripe

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: Next.js + React  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS or Rails/Django (CRUD‑heavy)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Auth: JWT/OAuth  
- Infra: AWS/Azure[1][4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$38,400–80,000**  
- Senior (5–7 weeks → 400–560 h): **$40,000–84,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)

---

## 5. Freelance Platform (Upwork/Fiverr‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, roles (client, freelancer)  
- Freelancer profiles (skills, portfolio, hourly/fixed rates)  
- Project posting (RFP) and/or “gig” listings  
- Search & filters (skills, price, rating, language)  
- Proposal/offer system (bid, accept, milestones)  
- Contracts (simple digital agreement record)  
- Payments & escrow‑like flow (basic Stripe split or phased release)[3][6]  
- Messaging, notifications  
- Ratings & reviews  
- Admin panel (disputes, refunds, commission settings)[3]

**Tech stack**  
Same as #1, plus:  
- More complex use of **Stripe Connect** (escrow simulation)  
- Optional: real‑time messaging via **WebSockets** (Socket.io)

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **14–18 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **9–11 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (14–18 weeks → 1,120–1,440 h): **$67,200–144,000**  
- Senior (9–11 weeks → 720–880 h): **$72,000–132,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 1 frontend dev  
- 1 backend‑heavy full‑stack dev  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 6. Course Marketplace (Udemy/Skillshare‑style)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]  
- Auth, roles (instructor, student)  
- Instructor onboarding and course creation (title, sections, video links, resources)  
- Course catalog, categories, search & filters  
- Course landing pages (curriculum, instructor, reviews)  
- Video hosting integration (e.g., Vimeo, AWS S3 + CloudFront for MVP)  
- Enrollment/purchase flow, payments & revenue share  
- Basic progress tracking (completed lectures)  
- Ratings & reviews  
- Admin panel (course approval, user mgmt, payouts)[3][6]

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: React + Next.js  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- File/video: S3 + CloudFront or Vimeo API  
- Payments: Stripe  
- Analytics: basic Mixpanel/GA for course engagement[1][4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **12–16 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (12–16 weeks → 960–1,280 h): **$57,600–128,000**  
- Senior (8–10 weeks → 640–800 h): **$64,000–120,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 7. Product Marketplace (Amazon/eBay‑style)

**Core MVP features**[3][6][7]  
- Auth, buyer/seller roles  
- Seller onboarding, product listing management (SKU, stock, price)  
- Catalog with categories, attributes, search & filters[3][6][7]  
- Product detail pages, images, variants  
- Cart & checkout  
- Payments (Stripe/PayPal) and commission logic[3][6]  
- Order management (status, shipping info)  
- Basic shipping options (flat rate or simple integrations)  
- Reviews & ratings[3][7]  
- Messaging (buyer–seller) and notifications[3]  
- Admin panel (moderation, commissions, refunds, vendor approval)[3][6]

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: React + Next.js  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS or Django  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Search: PostgreSQL full‑text or simple **Elasticsearch** later  
- Payments: Stripe Connect  
- Infra: AWS (S3 for images, RDS, CloudFront)[1][4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **14–18 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **9–11 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (14–18 weeks → 1,120–1,440 h): **$67,200–144,000**  
- Senior (9–11 weeks → 720–880 h): **$72,000–132,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 1 frontend dev  
- 1 backend‑heavy full‑stack dev  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

## 8. Booking Platform (Calendly/Acuity‑style)

**Core MVP features**[1][6]  
- Auth, user profiles  
- Calendar integration (Google Calendar at MVP)  
- Availability setup (slots, buffer times, meeting types)  
- Booking page per user (public link)  
- Booking flow (select slot → confirm → email confirmation)  
- Timezone handling  
- Basic payments per booking or subscription (Stripe)  
- Notifications (email) & reminders  
- Simple admin/settings for users (meeting types, branding)  
- Admin panel (user mgmt, basic metrics)[1][4]

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: React + Next.js  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Integrations: Google Calendar API, SendGrid/SES  
- Payments: Stripe (subscription or per‑booking)[1]  
- Infra: AWS

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **10–12 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **6–8 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (10–12 weeks → 800–960 h): **$48,000–96,000**  
- Senior (6–8 weeks → 480–640 h): **$48,000–96,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)

---

## 9. Event Platform (Eventbrite/Meetup‑style)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]  
- Auth, roles (organizer, attendee)  
- Organizer profiles  
- Event creation (title, description, date/time, location, capacity)  
- Event listing pages + search & filters (date, type, location)  
- Ticket types (free/paid), basic inventory  
- RSVP/ticket purchase flow, QR/ID code generation (basic)  
- Payments for paid events, organizer payouts  
- Email confirmations and reminders  
- Attendee list for organizers  
- Admin panel (event approval, refunds, payouts)

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: React + Next.js  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Payments: Stripe  
- Email: SendGrid/SES  
- Optional: simple analytics (registrations, sales)[1][4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **11–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (11–14 weeks → 880–1,120 h): **$52,800–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT, light)

---

## 10. Subscription Box Platform (Cratejoy‑style)

**Core MVP features**[6][7]  
- Auth, roles (merchant, subscriber)  
- Merchant onboarding, subscription product setup (plans, frequency, price)  
- Subscription catalog & product pages  
- Checkout with recurring billing (Stripe Subscriptions)  
- Subscription management (pause/cancel, address updates)  
- Basic order generation per billing cycle  
- Simple shipping status fields (manual for MVP)  
- Admin panel (merchants, plans, churn metrics, MRR basics)[1][4]  
- Email notifications (new sub, renewal, failed payment)

**Tech stack**  
- Frontend: React + Next.js  
- Backend: Node.js + NestJS (or Ruby on Rails, strong for subscriptions)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Payments: Stripe Billing / Subscriptions[1]  
- Infra: AWS or Azure[4]

**Timeline**  
- 2 mid‑tier: **11–14 weeks**  
- 2 senior: **7–9 weeks**

**Cost**  
- Mid‑tier (11–14 weeks → 880–1,120 h): **$52,800–112,000**  
- Senior (7–9 weeks → 560–720 h): **$56,000–108,000**

**Team composition**  
- 1 PM (PT)  
- 1 UX/UI (PT)  
- 2 full‑stack devs  
- 1 QA (PT)  
- 1 DevOps (PT)

---

**Notes on sources & structure**

- Marketplace MVP guides consistently call out **auth, listings, search/filtering, payments, reviews, and admin panel** as core MVP scope for marketplaces.[3][6][7]  
- SaaS MVP guides emphasize **cloud infra (AWS/Azure/GCP), Stripe/PayPal payments, and analytics** as best practice for 2024‑era MVPs.[1][4][5][8]  

If you want, I can next:  
- Convert this into a comparative table (types vs cost/time), or  
- Prioritize which 2–3 types are *cheapest/fastest* to build first.

mvp_types.name: Team Chat
mvp_types.research_summary:
Here is a concise, numbers-first planning view for each MVP type. Timelines and costs assume a modern SaaS stack, single platform (web) for v1, and *production-grade but limited* scope.

**Global assumptions**

- **Mid-tier dev rate:** $60–$100/hr → use **$80/hr** blended for estimates  
- **Senior dev rate:** $100–$150/hr → use **$125/hr** blended for estimates  
- 2 full‑time devs ≈ 320 hrs/month  

Benchmarks for SaaS MVP costs/timelines in 2025 back these ranges: **simple to medium SaaS MVP: $20k–$80k, 6–16 weeks**[2][3][1].

---

## 1. Team Chat MVP (Slack-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, basic org/workspace model  
- **Channels** (public/private), **direct messages**  
- Real-time **messages** (text), read status, typing indicator  
- Basic **search** (by channel/user, last 30 days)  
- File attachments (stored in S3 or similar), message reactions or emojis (optional)  
- Basic notifications (browser + email for mentions)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**, Next.js or Vite  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS/Express)** or **Ruby on Rails**  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Real-time: **WebSockets** via **Socket.IO**, or managed (**Pusher**, **Ably**, **Supabase Realtime**)  
- Infra: **AWS/GCP/Azure**, object storage (S3), **Redis** for pub/sub and presence  
- Auth: **JWT** or **Auth0/Supabase Auth**

Communication MVPs with real-time channels and presence are considered *high complexity* because of WebSockets and scaling[2].

**Timeline**

- With 2 mid-tier devs: **10–12 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **6–8 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 10–12 wks → 640–768 hrs → **$50k–$62k**  
- Senior: 6–8 wks → 384–512 hrs → **$48k–$64k**

(Within the $25k–$80k SaaS MVP band for complex, real-time products[2][3].)

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack engineer  
- 1 frontend/full-stack engineer  
- 0.2 PM/founder-as-PO  
- 0.2 UI/UX designer (part-time, 2–3 weeks)  
- 0.2 QA/manual tester

---

## 2. Video Conferencing MVP (Zoom-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, simple org (optional)  
- Schedule and **join meetings** (URL-based, 2–10 participants for MVP)  
- **Video + audio** calls, mute/unmute, device selection  
- Basic in-meeting **chat**  
- Screen sharing (single-screen)  
- Meeting host controls: end meeting, mute all  
- No recording or complex breakout rooms in MVP

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js/NestJS  
- Real-time media:  
  - **WebRTC** using **Twilio Video**, **Agora**, **Daily.co**, or **100ms** for v1 (drastically reduces effort)  
- Signaling & API: REST + WebSockets (or provided by vendor)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Infra: AWS/GCP; use vendor TURN/STUN or managed infra

A “basic Zoom-like MVP” with strong reliability often lands in the **$200k–$300k** range when fully custom media and infra are built[4]; using CPaaS significantly lowers first-MVP scope and cost.

**Timeline**

- 2 mid-tier devs: **14–16 weeks**  
- 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 14–16 wks → 896–1024 hrs → **$72k–$82k**  
- Senior: 8–10 wks → 512–640 hrs → **$64k–$80k**

(Still below a fully custom Zoom-like build[4], but above typical SaaS due to media complexity.)

**Team composition**

- 1 senior/full-stack or backend with WebRTC/CPaaS experience  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.3 DevOps (or senior dev covers)  
- 0.2 PM/product  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 3. Community Platform MVP (Discord-style / Circle-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, avatar, basic roles (admin/moderator/member)  
- **Spaces/servers** and **channels** (text only for MVP)  
- Real-time **chat** within channels  
- Simple **threaded replies**  
- Basic moderation: delete message, ban user  
- Simple notifications, basic search

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js (NestJS) or Django  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Real-time: WebSockets (Socket.IO) or managed (Pusher/Ably/Supabase Realtime)  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, Redis, S3 for avatars and uploads

Real-time team/community platforms with channels and roles line up with “high complexity” communication SaaS examples[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **10–12 weeks**  
- Senior: **6–8 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$50k–$62k**  
- Senior: **$48k–$64k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack  
- 1 frontend/full-stack  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UX/UI  
- 0.2 QA

---

## 4. Social Network MVP (Twitter/LinkedIn-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, user profiles, follow/following  
- **Feed/timeline** (reverse chronological for MVP)  
- Create posts (text + image), like, basic comments  
- Hashtags/mentions (simple parsing, not full graph search)  
- Notifications (new follower, like, comment)  
- Basic search (by username, tag)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript (Next.js)  
- Backend: Node.js or Ruby on Rails  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Caching/search: Redis, optional **Elasticsearch/OpenSearch** for search later  
- Real-time: WebSockets or SSE for live notifications and lightweight streaming updates  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, S3 for media

This is a **medium–high complexity** horizontal SaaS (multiple user flows, feeds, notifications) consistent with $25k–$80k MVP ranges[2][3].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 12–14 wks → 768–896 hrs → **$61k–$72k**  
- Senior: 8–10 wks → 512–640 hrs → **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend engineer (feed architecture, DB, APIs)  
- 1 frontend engineer (timeline UI, posting, profile pages)  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.3 UI/UX (information architecture is heavier here)  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 5. Forum/Q&A MVP (Reddit / Stack Overflow-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, reputation score (simple)  
- **Communities/categories** or tags  
- Create posts/questions; comments/answers  
- Upvotes/downvotes (no complex ranking yet)  
- Basic search and filters (category, tag)  
- Moderation: delete, lock, basic report flag

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Django or Ruby on Rails (very productive for CRUD + permissions)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Optional search: PostgreSQL full-text, can add Elasticsearch later  
- Real-time: Not strictly required; can add WebSockets/SSE for live updates later  
- Infra: AWS/GCP

CRUD-focused SaaS with multiple user roles and basic analytics is a classic **medium MVP** ($25k–$40k, 8–12 weeks)[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- Senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 8–10 wks → 512–640 hrs → **$41k–$51k**  
- Senior: 5–7 wks → 320–448 hrs → **$40k–$56k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack  
- 1 frontend/full-stack  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.2 QA

---

## 6. Live Streaming MVP (Twitch / YouTube Live-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, simple creator vs viewer roles  
- **Go live** (single broadcaster) and **watch stream** pages  
- Live chat for each stream  
- Basic stream discovery (list of live streams, simple categories)  
- Viewer count, basic analytics (live viewers, total views)  
- No VOD library, no complex monetization in MVP

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js  
- Streaming:  
  - **Managed live video**: Mux, AWS IVS, Agora, Livepeer, etc., using HLS/DASH  
- Real-time chat: WebSockets (Socket.IO) or managed (Pusher/Ably)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Infra: AWS/GCP + vendor streaming infra (CDN, encoding)

Like video calls, custom low-latency streaming infra is expensive; using managed services keeps MVP costs closer to the higher end of SaaS benchmarks rather than full media infra budgets[4].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **14–16 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$72k–$82k**  
- Senior: **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/streaming-focused engineer  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.3 DevOps (or senior dev covers infra)  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 7. Messaging App MVP (WhatsApp / Telegram-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth (phone or email), profile, contacts list  
- **1:1 chats**, basic group chats  
- Real-time messaging (text); message status: sent/delivered/seen (simple)  
- Media attachments (images, small video, docs)  
- Message search (per chat, last N messages)  
- Push notifications (web/mobile depending on platform)  
- Optional: basic encryption (transport-level TLS; full E2E is v2)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend (web MVP): React + TypeScript; for mobile MVP: React Native/Flutter  
- Backend: Node.js (NestJS) or Go  
- DB: PostgreSQL (messages, users), possibly partitioning by user later  
- Real-time: WebSockets (Socket.IO), or managed (PubNub, Pusher, Ably)  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, Redis, S3

Real-time messaging with presence and media is similar in complexity to a **team communication platform**, considered high-complexity SaaS in cost breakdowns[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$61k–$72k**  
- Senior: **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend engineer (messaging model, delivery semantics)  
- 1 frontend/mobile engineer  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 8. Email Platform MVP (Gmail / Superhuman-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, connect existing email account(s) via **IMAP/SMTP** or provider APIs (Gmail/Outlook)  
- **Inbox list**, read email, send email, basic reply/forward  
- Basic labels/folders and search (provider-side where possible)  
- Simple shortcuts (for productivity positioning)  
- Basic notifications (new email)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js or Ruby on Rails  
- Email integration:  
  - Provider APIs (Gmail API, Outlook, etc.) where possible;  
  - Fall back to IMAP/SMTP libraries  
- DB: PostgreSQL (users, metadata, not necessarily full message bodies at first)  
- Real-time: Webhooks + WebSockets/SSE for new-message events  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, background workers (BullMQ, Sidekiq, etc.)

Email-heavy products tend toward **medium–high complexity** SaaS: multiple external integrations, background jobs, and security[3].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$61k–$72k**  
- Senior: **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/integration-heavy engineer  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 9. Newsletter Platform MVP (Substack / Beehiiv-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, creator profiles  
- Create and edit **newsletter posts** (rich text editor)  
- Subscriber management (import CSV, signup form)  
- Send newsletter via **email provider** (SendGrid/SES/Mailgun)  
- Basic analytics: opens, clicks (per campaign)  
- Simple landing page per creator, subscription form  
- Stripe-based **paid subscription** optional but common in MVP

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: Next.js (React + TypeScript)  
- Backend: Node.js/Rails/Django  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Email: SendGrid, Amazon SES, Mailgun  
- Payments: Stripe Billing  
- Real-time: Not required beyond simple job status; can use WebSockets/SSE for live stats later  
- Infra: AWS/GCP

This fits a **medium SaaS MVP** (20–30 features; multiple roles, email notifications, basic analytics)[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- Senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$41k–$51k**  
- Senior: **$40k–$56k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack (emails, Stripe, analytics)  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.2 QA

---

## 10. Content Sharing MVP (Medium / Pinterest-style)

**Core MVP features**

Choose focus; I’ll assume **Medium-style** with light Pinterest flavor:

- Auth, profiles, follow authors  
- **Create posts** with rich text editor (images embedded)  
- Browse feed (by latest, by followed authors)  
- Tagging/categories, basic search  
- Likes/reactions, saves/bookmarks  
- Simple reading stats (views, read time approx)  
- Optional: collections/boards (for Pinterest-style grouping)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript (Next.js)  
- Backend: Django or Rails (productive for CRUD + tagging)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Search: DB full-text initially, Elasticsearch/OpenSearch later  
- Real-time: Not required beyond maybe live editor autosave (can be via polling or WebSockets)  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, S3 for images

CRUD with content feeds and basic analytics is aligned with **basic to mid-level SaaS** ($25k–$60k MVP)[2][3].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- Senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$41k–$51k**  
- Senior: **$40k–$56k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack  
- 1 frontend  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.3 UI/UX (editor + reading experience)  
- 0.2 QA

---

**How this aligns with 2025 SaaS MVP benchmarks**

- SaaS MVPs generally fall between **$20k–$80k** and **6–16 weeks** depending on complexity, real-time features, and integrations[2][3][1].  
- Real-time communication platforms (chat, team comms, live media) consistently sit at the **upper half** of that range due to WebSockets, state syncing, and scaling challenges[2].  
- Complex media (video conferencing, live streaming) can easily reach **$200k–$300k+** for robust Zoom-like products when built fully custom[4], which is why using CPaaS and constrained scope is critical for an MVP.

mvp_types.name: Video Conferencing

**Global assumptions**

- **Mid-tier dev rate:** $60–$100/hr → use **$80/hr** blended for estimates  
- **Senior dev rate:** $100–$150/hr → use **$125/hr** blended for estimates  
- 2 full‑time devs ≈ 320 hrs/month  

Benchmarks for SaaS MVP costs/timelines in 2025 back these ranges: **simple to medium SaaS MVP: $20k–$80k, 6–16 weeks**[2][3][1].

---

## 1. Team Chat MVP (Slack-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, basic org/workspace model  
- **Channels** (public/private), **direct messages**  
- Real-time **messages** (text), read status, typing indicator  
- Basic **search** (by channel/user, last 30 days)  
- File attachments (stored in S3 or similar), message reactions or emojis (optional)  
- Basic notifications (browser + email for mentions)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS/Express)** or **Ruby on Rails**  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Real-time: **WebSockets** via **Socket.IO**, or managed (**Pusher**, **Ably**, **Supabase Realtime**)  
- Infra: **AWS/GCP/Azure**, object storage (S3), **Redis** for pub/sub and presence  
- Auth: **JWT** or **Auth0/Supabase Auth**

Communication MVPs with real-time channels and presence are considered *high complexity* because of WebSockets and scaling[2].

**Timeline**

- With 2 mid-tier devs: **10–12 weeks**  
- With 2 senior devs: **6–8 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 10–12 wks → 640–768 hrs → **$50k–$62k**  
- Senior: 6–8 wks → 384–512 hrs → **$48k–$64k**

(Within the $25k–$80k SaaS MVP band for complex, real-time products[2][3].)

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack engineer  
- 1 frontend/full-stack engineer  
- 0.2 PM/founder-as-PO  
- 0.2 UI/UX designer (part-time, 2–3 weeks)  
- 0.2 QA/manual tester

---

## 2. Video Conferencing MVP (Zoom-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, simple org (optional)  
- Schedule and **join meetings** (URL-based, 2–10 participants for MVP)  
- **Video + audio** calls, mute/unmute, device selection  
- Basic in-meeting **chat**  
- Screen sharing (single-screen)  
- Meeting host controls: end meeting, mute all  
- No recording or complex breakout rooms in MVP

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js/NestJS  
- Real-time media:  
  - **WebRTC** using **Twilio Video**, **Agora**, **Daily.co**, or **100ms** for v1 (drastically reduces effort)  
- Signaling & API: REST + WebSockets (or provided by vendor)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Infra: AWS/GCP; use vendor TURN/STUN or managed infra

A “basic Zoom-like MVP” with strong reliability often lands in the **$200k–$300k** range when fully custom media and infra are built[4]; using CPaaS significantly lowers first-MVP scope and cost.

**Timeline**

- 2 mid-tier devs: **14–16 weeks**  
- 2 senior devs: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 14–16 wks → 896–1024 hrs → **$72k–$82k**  
- Senior: 8–10 wks → 512–640 hrs → **$64k–$80k**

(Still below a fully custom Zoom-like build[4], but above typical SaaS due to media complexity.)

**Team composition**

- 1 senior/full-stack or backend with WebRTC/CPaaS experience  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.3 DevOps (or senior dev covers)  
- 0.2 PM/product  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 3. Community Platform MVP (Discord-style / Circle-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, avatar, basic roles (admin/moderator/member)  
- **Spaces/servers** and **channels** (text only for MVP)  
- Real-time **chat** within channels  
- Simple **threaded replies**  
- Basic moderation: delete message, ban user  
- Simple notifications, basic search

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js (NestJS) or Django  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Real-time: WebSockets (Socket.IO) or managed (Pusher/Ably/Supabase Realtime)  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, Redis, S3 for avatars and uploads

Real-time team/community platforms with channels and roles line up with “high complexity” communication SaaS examples[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **10–12 weeks**  
- Senior: **6–8 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$50k–$62k**  
- Senior: **$48k–$64k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack  
- 1 frontend/full-stack  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UX/UI  
- 0.2 QA

---

## 4. Social Network MVP (Twitter/LinkedIn-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, user profiles, follow/following  
- **Feed/timeline** (reverse chronological for MVP)  
- Create posts (text + image), like, basic comments  
- Hashtags/mentions (simple parsing, not full graph search)  
- Notifications (new follower, like, comment)  
- Basic search (by username, tag)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript (Next.js)  
- Backend: Node.js or Ruby on Rails  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Caching/search: Redis, optional **Elasticsearch/OpenSearch** for search later  
- Real-time: WebSockets or SSE for live notifications and lightweight streaming updates  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, S3 for media

This is a **medium–high complexity** horizontal SaaS (multiple user flows, feeds, notifications) consistent with $25k–$80k MVP ranges[2][3].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 12–14 wks → 768–896 hrs → **$61k–$72k**  
- Senior: 8–10 wks → 512–640 hrs → **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend engineer (feed architecture, DB, APIs)  
- 1 frontend engineer (timeline UI, posting, profile pages)  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.3 UI/UX (information architecture is heavier here)  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 5. Forum/Q&A MVP (Reddit / Stack Overflow-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, reputation score (simple)  
- **Communities/categories** or tags  
- Create posts/questions; comments/answers  
- Upvotes/downvotes (no complex ranking yet)  
- Basic search and filters (category, tag)  
- Moderation: delete, lock, basic report flag

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Django or Ruby on Rails (very productive for CRUD + permissions)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Optional search: PostgreSQL full-text, can add Elasticsearch later  
- Real-time: Not strictly required; can add WebSockets/SSE for live updates later  
- Infra: AWS/GCP

CRUD-focused SaaS with multiple user roles and basic analytics is a classic **medium MVP** ($25k–$40k, 8–12 weeks)[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- Senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: 8–10 wks → 512–640 hrs → **$41k–$51k**  
- Senior: 5–7 wks → 320–448 hrs → **$40k–$56k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack  
- 1 frontend/full-stack  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.2 QA

---

## 6. Live Streaming MVP (Twitch / YouTube Live-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, simple creator vs viewer roles  
- **Go live** (single broadcaster) and **watch stream** pages  
- Live chat for each stream  
- Basic stream discovery (list of live streams, simple categories)  
- Viewer count, basic analytics (live viewers, total views)  
- No VOD library, no complex monetization in MVP

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js  
- Streaming:  
  - **Managed live video**: Mux, AWS IVS, Agora, Livepeer, etc., using HLS/DASH  
- Real-time chat: WebSockets (Socket.IO) or managed (Pusher/Ably)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Infra: AWS/GCP + vendor streaming infra (CDN, encoding)

Like video calls, custom low-latency streaming infra is expensive; using managed services keeps MVP costs closer to the higher end of SaaS benchmarks rather than full media infra budgets[4].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **14–16 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$72k–$82k**  
- Senior: **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/streaming-focused engineer  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.3 DevOps (or senior dev covers infra)  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 7. Messaging App MVP (WhatsApp / Telegram-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth (phone or email), profile, contacts list  
- **1:1 chats**, basic group chats  
- Real-time messaging (text); message status: sent/delivered/seen (simple)  
- Media attachments (images, small video, docs)  
- Message search (per chat, last N messages)  
- Push notifications (web/mobile depending on platform)  
- Optional: basic encryption (transport-level TLS; full E2E is v2)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend (web MVP): React + TypeScript; for mobile MVP: React Native/Flutter  
- Backend: Node.js (NestJS) or Go  
- DB: PostgreSQL (messages, users), possibly partitioning by user later  
- Real-time: WebSockets (Socket.IO), or managed (PubNub, Pusher, Ably)  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, Redis, S3

Real-time messaging with presence and media is similar in complexity to a **team communication platform**, considered high-complexity SaaS in cost breakdowns[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$61k–$72k**  
- Senior: **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend engineer (messaging model, delivery semantics)  
- 1 frontend/mobile engineer  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 8. Email Platform MVP (Gmail / Superhuman-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, profiles, connect existing email account(s) via **IMAP/SMTP** or provider APIs (Gmail/Outlook)  
- **Inbox list**, read email, send email, basic reply/forward  
- Basic labels/folders and search (provider-side where possible)  
- Simple shortcuts (for productivity positioning)  
- Basic notifications (new email)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript  
- Backend: Node.js or Ruby on Rails  
- Email integration:  
  - Provider APIs (Gmail API, Outlook, etc.) where possible;  
  - Fall back to IMAP/SMTP libraries  
- DB: PostgreSQL (users, metadata, not necessarily full message bodies at first)  
- Real-time: Webhooks + WebSockets/SSE for new-message events  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, background workers (BullMQ, Sidekiq, etc.)

Email-heavy products tend toward **medium–high complexity** SaaS: multiple external integrations, background jobs, and security[3].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **12–14 weeks**  
- Senior: **8–10 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$61k–$72k**  
- Senior: **$64k–$80k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/integration-heavy engineer  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.3 QA

---

## 9. Newsletter Platform MVP (Substack / Beehiiv-style)

**Core MVP features**

- Auth, creator profiles  
- Create and edit **newsletter posts** (rich text editor)  
- Subscriber management (import CSV, signup form)  
- Send newsletter via **email provider** (SendGrid/SES/Mailgun)  
- Basic analytics: opens, clicks (per campaign)  
- Simple landing page per creator, subscription form  
- Stripe-based **paid subscription** optional but common in MVP

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: Next.js (React + TypeScript)  
- Backend: Node.js/Rails/Django  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Email: SendGrid, Amazon SES, Mailgun  
- Payments: Stripe Billing  
- Real-time: Not required beyond simple job status; can use WebSockets/SSE for live stats later  
- Infra: AWS/GCP

This fits a **medium SaaS MVP** (20–30 features; multiple roles, email notifications, basic analytics)[2].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- Senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$41k–$51k**  
- Senior: **$40k–$56k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack (emails, Stripe, analytics)  
- 1 frontend engineer  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.2 UI/UX  
- 0.2 QA

---

## 10. Content Sharing MVP (Medium / Pinterest-style)

**Core MVP features**

Choose focus; I’ll assume **Medium-style** with light Pinterest flavor:

- Auth, profiles, follow authors  
- **Create posts** with rich text editor (images embedded)  
- Browse feed (by latest, by followed authors)  
- Tagging/categories, basic search  
- Likes/reactions, saves/bookmarks  
- Simple reading stats (views, read time approx)  
- Optional: collections/boards (for Pinterest-style grouping)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: React + TypeScript (Next.js)  
- Backend: Django or Rails (productive for CRUD + tagging)  
- DB: PostgreSQL  
- Search: DB full-text initially, Elasticsearch/OpenSearch later  
- Real-time: Not required beyond maybe live editor autosave (can be via polling or WebSockets)  
- Infra: AWS/GCP, S3 for images

CRUD with content feeds and basic analytics is aligned with **basic to mid-level SaaS** ($25k–$60k MVP)[2][3].

**Timeline**

- Mid-tier: **8–10 weeks**  
- Senior: **5–7 weeks**

**Cost**

- Mid-tier: **$41k–$51k**  
- Senior: **$40k–$56k**

**Team composition**

- 1 backend/full-stack  
- 1 frontend  
- 0.2 PM  
- 0.3 UI/UX (editor + reading experience)  
- 0.2 QA

---

**How this aligns with 2025 SaaS MVP benchmarks**

- SaaS MVPs generally fall between **$20k–$80k** and **6–16 weeks** depending on complexity, real-time features, and integrations[2][3][1].  
- Real-time communication platforms (chat, team comms, live media) consistently sit at the **upper half** of that range due to WebSockets, state syncing, and scaling challenges[2].  
- Complex media (video conferencing, live streaming) can easily reach **$200k–$300k+** for robust Zoom-like products when built fully custom[4], which is why using CPaaS and constrained scope is critical for an MVP.

mvp_types.name: Community Platform
mvp_types.research_summary:
Here is a concise, numbers-first planning view for each MVP type. Timelines and costs assume a modern SaaS stack, single platform (web) for v1, and *production-grade but limited* scope.

**Global assumptions**

- **Mid-tier dev rate:** $60–$100/hr → use **$80/hr** blended for estimates  
- **Senior dev rate:** $100–$150/hr → use **$125/hr** blended for estimates  
- 2 full‑time devs ≈ 320 hrs/month  

Benchmarks for SaaS MVP costs/timelines in 2025 back these ranges: **simple to medium SaaS MVP: $20k–$80k, 6–16 weeks**[2][3][1].

---

## 1. Team Chat MVP (Slack-style)

- Basic **search** (by channel/user, last 30 days)  
- File attachments (stored in S3 or similar), message reactions or emojis (optional)  
- Basic notifications (browser + email for mentions)

**Recommended tech stack**

- Frontend: **React + TypeScript**, Next.js or Vite  
- Backend: **Node.js (NestJS/Express)** or **Ruby on Rails**  
- DB: **PostgreSQL**  
- Real-time: **WebSockets** via **Socket.IO**, or managed (**Pusher**, **Ably**, **Supabase Realtime**)  
- Infra: **AWS/GCP/Azure**, object storage (S3), **Redis** for pub/sub and presence

Communication MVPs with real-time channels and presence are considered *high complexity* because of WebSockets and scaling[2].

- With 2 senior devs: **6–8 weeks**
